abstract: Apple plans to begin selling the long-awaited, faster 3G version of its iPhone by August in some European countries, as part of an expanded rollout announced on Tuesday.
snippet: Apple plans to begin selling the long-awaited, faster 3G version of its iPhone by August in some European countries, as part of an expanded rollout announced on Tuesday.
lead_paragraph: BERLIN  Apple plans to begin selling the long-awaited, faster 3G version of its best-selling iPhone by the August summer holidays in some European countries, a person close to the situation said, as part of an expanded introduction of the device to 10 countries that was announced Tuesday.

headline.main: August Said to Be Target for New iPhone in Europe
headline.print_headline: August Said to Be Target for New iPhone in Europe
